@lewdaccount I think it's more likely that other reincarnated humans were there in the past. If I remember correctly, it's never explicitly stated, but from what I get it's implied that magic wasn't always encoded like this, but someone made it like that to stop the public from using it. I don't know what is the goal of this person, but I'm betting that this world was heavily influenced by the few humans that reincarnated there, instead of it having been created by humans in the first place.
@lewdaccount I'm pretty sure everyone here gets it no need to explain lmao
It's kind of funny how there is an actual plot underneath all the sex. Translating and editing pages of exposition is such a weird experience compared to the normal intercourse dialogue.

Pary 2: this is inportant because it confirms one of two thingns which we will most likely learn in the next part. Either 1: other reincarnated humans were here before norun and Rabimea, or 2:(the more likely one) the admin system exists because this world was created by humans for what reason? We dont know yet. Im sure well find out soon enough. I apologize for all the spelling and grammar mistakes, im not an English teacher, I just really enjoy story arc.

To anyone who doesnt understand how the magic works in this series it works like this from what i understand (part 1): Chise had the ability to use magic, the magic is very similar to a command system that can be used for coding. Norun can break a items that take away the ability to use magic, this means he is more powerfull than chise as he can bypass certain restrictions such as an admin. Because he can bypass a restriction that prevents the use of magic he can use magic himself. Back to the magic itself. From whar we learn the fact that the magic id sinilar to a coding system means that this world was possibly created by humans from earth, and this is all just a simulation where some people go after they die. We learn in this chapter that language from earth is not used when they say that they used language "from our world" which suggests they use a different language. Why is this important?
